newsitem.title: USA: AFTER THE BELL - Cisco falls on earnings.
newsitem.headline: AFTER THE BELL - Cisco falls on earnings.

text.p: Shares in Cisco Systems Inc fell in after-hours trading Tuesday, immediately after the company released fourth quarter earnings that met Street expectations but missed the whisper.

Cisco shares dropped from a close of 81-15/16 down to 79-5/8 after the company reported a fourth quarter profit of $0.55 per share. Wall Street had expected the company to post $0.55 per share earnings, but traders said some unpublished forecasts had called for profits of up to $0.60 a share.
"There's still a good amount of interest in Cisco," one dealer said.
Some analysts had expected Cisco earnings to exceed expectations, citing struggles among its competitors and the company's smooth management of a transition to new technology.
Including one-time charges, fourth quarter earnings for the world's biggest maker of networking gear were $0.22 per share. The company reported revenues of $1.8 billion.

Also moving lower after the bell was Viasoft Inc, which was trading at 63, down from a close of 64. The company reported fourth quarter earnings of $0.22 per share, above First Call's $0.19 per share consensus estimate.
The New York Stock Exchange said session one had volume of 37,500, compared with 13,600 Monday and session two had volume of 320,241 compared with 4.1 million.
